description.S1: One of Zoe's journal entries revealed that she secretly planned to run away and join the marauder camp to the east.
description.S2: Now that you know her location,
description.S3: head to the camp and see if she's okay.

blurb.B1: Zoe is hiding out with the marauders based in the abandoned industrial zone in the northeastern part of Emerald Vale.
blurb.B2: These marauders will be hostile on sight.
blurb.B4: Zoe will appear in the street in the center of the area.

description.S1: Zoe is perfectly fine and somehow living amongst marauders.
description.S2: She seems to be content with her situation,
description.S3: so it'll take some convincing to get her to return to her people.

blurb.B1: Zoe is unharmed and very impressed with how the Stranger killed all the marauders "like some sort of heroic accountant running down a list".
blurb.B2: She doesn't want to return to the camp,
blurb.B3: believing that she belongs with the marauders.
blurb.B4: Talking to her will show that she traded Adrena-Time in order to join the confidence of the Marauders.
blurb.B5: She will tell you she was kicked out from Edgewater for getting sick and stealing medicine.
blurb.B6: She joined the Botanical Lab expecting outlaws and instead found a peaceful community, not to her liking.
blurb.B7: She can be convinced with a Persuade 15 or Intimidate 65 check.
blurb.B8: Persuading her will give you the option to talk about Stefan,
blurb.B9: and if you talked to him you can bring up the surprise episode he had prepared.
blurb.B10: This will yield 1125XP and she will return to the Botanical Lab.
blurb.B11: Alternatively, Zoe can be killed for the 8 Adrena-Time that she is carrying.
blurb.B12: Zoe's ring can be looted from her corpse as proof of what "happened" to her.

description.S1: You convinced Zoe to return to the Camp.
description.S2: Grace will want to hear the good news.

blurb.B1: Go back to Grace at the Botanical Lab and you can tell her the truth about Zoe joining up with Marauders,
blurb.B2: or tell her she wanted to be an outlaw.
blurb.B3: Telling her the truth does not cause any problems and rewards with 4125xp and increased positive reputation with the Deserters faction,
blurb.B4: If you Lie (5) to Grace, assuming you killed her,
blurb.B5: and say you had to put her down,
blurb.B6: you will gain some extra XP and you can show her Zoe's ring as proof she is dead.
blurb.B7: This will net you 4000 XP, Deserters Reputation and a Bolter Pistol.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: Wow. You crossed 'em all off. Like some sort of heroic accountant running down a list. Teach me your ways?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You're Zoe? Your people are looking for you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Not for free.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: What, you mean Adelaide's little congregation of nature-loving nobodies? I could not possibly be less interested in them.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: You, on the other hand. You were a sight to behold. If I had half your skills, I'd be the greatest outlaw the coast has ever seen.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: What I wouldn't do for a Wentsworth.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I've been sent to find you.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: You should go back. People are worried.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I need you to clarify something for me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'll be back.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: Why? Adelaide wants me back on garden duty or something? Thanks, but I'm not going anywhere. This is where I belong.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: I doubt that. Nobody in that camp really cared about me.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: What about Stefan? You two were friends.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Stefan's planning to surprise you with an episode of your favorite serial.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: Yeah, I suppose you're right. Also, he could carry on a conversation, unlike these hooligans.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'll take my stuff and head on back, I suppose. Grace is gonna be glaring knives at me. So I've got that to look forward to.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Take care.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: Wait, you're telling me he's got a copy of the Masked Marketeer? Why didn't you say so?

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: I'm great at clarifying.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: Are you a prisoner here?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: How are you even alive?

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: There was something else, actually.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: Uh, no? I insinuated myself into their company, see. And they didn't seem to mind one whit.

dialog.speaker: Player
dialog.utterance: I'm impressed. How'd you pull it off?

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: I may have bartered them a few boxes of Adrena-Time, but I'm sure that's got nothing to do with it.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: I don't know. The vital processes that constitute the miracle of life are mysterious and unknowable.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: Oh, you mean around these guys? The marauders wouldn't hurt me. They love me. I'm practically their queen. Must be my natural charisma.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: I've got all the time in Halcyon.

dialog.speaker: ZoeChandler (Female)
dialog.utterance: Aw. Well, that's a shame. I mean I could pay you in Adrena-Time, but I've already bartered most of my stash over to these poor saps.
